feasts: The Martyrdom of St. Stephen the Archdeacon.
The Martyrdom of St. Lawindianus (Leontius).
1 Toba.summary: Commemorates the martyrdom of St. Stephen, the first Christian martyr, stoned for his faith, and St. Leontius, tortured and beheaded for refusing to worship idols.

feasts: The Departure of St. Theonas, 16th Pope of Alexandria.
The Martyrdom of St. Callinicus, Bishop of Oseem.
2 Toba.summary: Marks the departure of St. Theonas, who built a church for Virgin Mary, and the martyrdom of St. Callinicus, tortured and killed for his faith.

feasts: The Commemoration of the Slain Children of Bethlehem by King Herod
3 Toba.summary: Commemorates the massacre of Bethlehem’s male children by King Herod, fulfilling Jeremiah’s prophecy of mourning.

feasts: The Departure of St. John the Evangelist and Theologian
4 Toba.summary: Marks the departure of St. John, apostle and evangelist, who preached in Ephesus and wrote the Gospel, Revelation, and three epistles.

feasts: The Martyrdom of St. Eusegnius (Eugenius) the Soldier
5 Toba.summary: Commemorates St. Eusegnius, a soldier martyred under Emperor Julian for boldly confessing Christ.

feasts: The Commemoration of the Circumcision of the Lord Christ.
The Ascension of Elijah the Prophet.
The Departure of St. Marcianus, 8th Pope of Alexandria.
The Departure of St. Basil the Great, Bishop of Caesarea.
6 Toba.summary: Celebrates Christ’s circumcision, Elijah’s ascent to heaven, the departure of Pope Marcianus, and St. Basil, Bishop of Caesarea, known for his liturgy and miracles.

feasts: The Departure of St. Silvester, Pope of Rome
7 Toba.summary: Marks the departure of St. Silvester, Pope of Rome, who baptized Emperor Constantine and combated heresies.

feasts: The Consecration of St. Macarius’ Church.
The Departure of St. Andronicus, 37th Pope of Alexandria.
The Departure of St. Benjamin, 38th Pope of Alexandria.
8 Toba.summary: Commemorates the consecration of St. Macarius’ Church and the departures of Popes Andronicus and Benjamin, who faced persecution and restored churches.

feasts: The Departure of Abba Abraam, Companion of Abba Gawarga
9 Toba.summary: Marks the departure of St. Abraam, a monk who led an ascetic life and was visited by Christ.

feasts: Paramouni of Holy Theophany (Epiphany)
10 Toba.summary: A day of fasting in preparation for the Epiphany, blessing water and seeking purification.

feasts: The Holy Theophany of Our Lord, Jesus Christ (Baptism of the Lord)
11 Toba.summary: Celebrates Christ’s baptism, where the Holy Trinity was revealed with the Father’s voice and the Spirit as a dove.

feasts: The Commemoration of the Archangel Michael.
The Martyrdom of St. Theodore El-Mishreke (the Oriental).
The Martyrdom of St. Anatole (Anatolius).
12 Toba.summary: Honors Archangel Michael, and the martyrdoms of St. Theodore, a prince, and St. Anatole, both killed for their faith.

feasts: The Commemoration of the Miracle at Cana of Galilee.
The Departure of St. Theophilus, the Monk.
The Martyrdom of St. Demiana.
13 Toba.summary: Commemorates Christ’s first miracle at Cana, the departure of monk St. Theophilus, and the martyrdom of St. Demiana.

14 Toba.summary: No specific saints or events commemorated on this day.

15 Toba.summary: No specific saints or events commemorated on this day.

16 Toba.summary: No specific saints or events commemorated on this day.

17 Toba.summary: No specific saints or events commemorated on this day.

18 Toba.summary: No specific saints or events commemorated on this day.

19 Toba.summary: No specific saints or events commemorated on this day.

feasts: The Departure of St. Prochorus, One of the Seventy Disciples.
The Commemoration of the Consecration of the Church of St. John.
The Martyrdom of Anba Behna and Anba Kloag, the Priest.
20 Toba.summary: Marks the departure of St. Prochorus, a disciple and bishop, the consecration of St. John’s church, and the martyrdoms of Sts. Behna and Kloag.

feasts: The Dormition of Our Lady, the Virgin Mary.
The Departure of St. Hilaria, Daughter of Emperor Zeno.
The Departure of St. Gregorius (Gregory of Nyssa).
21 Toba.summary: Commemorates the Virgin Mary’s dormition, St. Hilaria’s monastic life, and St. Gregory of Nyssa’s departure.

feasts: The Departure of St. Anthony the Great (Antonius)
22 Toba.summary: Marks the departure of St. Anthony, father of monasticism, who lived ascetically and fought the devil’s temptations.

feasts: The Martyrdom of St. Timothy, the Apostle.
The Departure of Pope Cyril IV, 110th Pope of Alexandria.
23 Toba.summary: Commemorates the martyrdom of St. Timothy, bishop of Ephesus, and the departure of Pope Cyril IV, who advanced Coptic education.

feasts: The Departure of St. Mary the Ascetic (The Shut-In).
The Martyrdom of Anba Bisada (St. Psati), the Priest.
24 Toba.summary: Marks the departure of St. Mary, an ascetic who lived enclosed, and the martyrdom of St. Bisada, a priest killed for his faith.

feasts: The Departure of St. Peter, the Worshipper.
The Martyrdom of St. Askala (Asela), the Ascetic.
25 Toba.summary: Commemorates St. Peter, a reformed tax collector turned monk, and the martyrdom of St. Askala, an ascetic.

feasts: The Martyrdom of the Forty-Nine Saints, Elders of Sheheat.
The Departure of St. Anastasia.
26 Toba.summary: Honors the martyrdom of 49 elders of Sheheat by berbers and the departure of St. Anastasia, who lived as a monk in disguise.

feasts: The Martyrdom of St. Sarapion.
The Commemoration of the Archangel Suriel.
The Relocation of the Relics of St. Timothy, the Apostle.
The Martyrdom of St. Abe-Fam, the Soldier.
27 Toba.summary: Commemorates St. Sarapion’s martyrdom, Archangel Suriel, the transfer of St. Timothy’s relics, and St. Abe-Fam’s martyrdom.

feasts: The Martyrdom of St. Clement.
The Martyrdom of St. Anba Kaou.
28 Toba.summary: Marks the martyrdoms of St. Clement, tortured for his faith, and St. Kaou, beheaded for smashing an idol.

feasts: The Departure of St. Eksani (St. Xene).
The Commemoration of St. Seriakos (Syriacus), the Fighter.
29 Toba.summary: Commemorates St. Eksani, a noblewoman who became a nun, and St. Seriakos, a fighter for the faith.

feasts: The Martyrdom of Saints Pistis, Helpis, Agape, and Their Mother, Sophia
30 Toba.summary: Honors the martyrdom of Sts. Pistis, Helpis, Agape, and their mother Sophia, killed for refusing to worship idols.
